intro: Microula ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf microula, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with limited water availability. Microula ovalifolia is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
